item.title: Homelab Beginnings
item.description: Recently, after having graduated from college, I figured I wanted to spend some of the cash I saved up during college to finally kickstart a real homelab. A couple goals to keep in mind: Wanted to be able to run more intensive programs, distributed stuff (MPI, RPC) on ‘separate’ machines. Virtual clusters for the distributed stuff, and compiling bigger projects would ease my pain for things like contributing to big open source projects (Linux kernel, Firefox, which I wanted to do but haven’t had the heart to try and get into).

item.title: Alan Wake Retrospective
item.description: Since I’ve graduated, I’ve finally got some time to finish some of the games I bought a while ago. I thought it’d be interesting to talk about how I felt about some of those games I finished in a ‘review’ of sorts. For the most part, this retrospective does have some spoilers, since the most intriguing part of the game is the plot. To start things off, I’ve been playing a classic from the 2010s, Alan Wake, made by Remedy Entertainment.

item.title: About
item.description: A blog that I occasionally update; just for me to write about things that I find interesting. Hopefully it serves as a motivator for me to keep up with tech stuff, but also with a bunch of miscellaneous topics as well.

item.title: The_non_first_post
item.description: This is a reboot of the blog that I had earlier at this domain; a couple years ago, I started getting pretty bogged down by college and stopped posting to keep focused. I’ve since graduated at this point, so I figured I would wipe my blog clean and do it over. So, this is that post. Switched up the theme as well, this is much more clean. Maybe at some point, I’ll even try to self-host this site instead of running it off Github and using a different domain name for it.
